title: Ex-Obama Official: Appeasement Led To Ban On Saying ‘Radical Islam’
text:
Trump Takes O’Reilly Behind The Scenes Of Final Talk With Obama 
“To defeat radical Islamic extremism, we needed our Islamic allies — the Jordanians, the Emiratis, the Egyptians, the Saudis — and they believed that term unfairly vilified a whole religion,” wrote Stengel, who throughout his piece defends the Obama administration and criticizes Trump’s policies. 
Middle Eastern nations “did not consider the Islamic State to be Islamic,” Stengel said, and so the Obama administration “took a lot of care to describe the Islamic State as a terrorist group that acted in the name of Islam.” 
”… it didn’t help to call them radical Islamic terrorists,” he added. Advertisement - story continues below 
In his column, Stengel refers to ISIS as “not just a terrorist group,” but “an idea.” 
“Its rallying cry is that the West is hostile to Islam and that every good Muslim has a duty to join the caliphate,” he said. 
“Most of the group’s propaganda was not violent at all. I saw thousands of tweets about how beautiful the caliphate was. There were videos of kids on Ferris wheels and jihadi fighters distributing cotton candy,” he wrote. The threat from radical Islamic terrorism is very real, just look at what is happening in Europe and the Middle-East. Courts must act fast! 
— Donald J. Trump (@realDonaldTrump) February 7, 2017 Advertisement - story continues below
